image.caption: Collection of the U.S. House of Representatives

profileText: A Representative from New York; born in Rochester, N.Y., November 25, 1878; attended private schools; was graduated from Georgetown University, Washington, D.C., in 1901 and from the law department of Harvard University in 1904; was admitted to the bar in 1904 and commenced practice in Rochester, N.Y.; member of the Rochester (N.Y.) School Board 1905-1932; member of the New York State Alcoholic Beverage Control Board in 1933 and 1934; elected as a Democrat to the Seventy-fourth Congress (January 3, 1935-January 3, 1937); unsuccessful candidate for renomination in 1936; appointed by Governor Lehman justice of the supreme court of the State of New York, seventh judicial district, for term expiring December 31, 1937; member of the State Probation Commission 1938-1944; resumed the practice of law; died in Rochester, N.Y., January 8, 1969; interment in Holy Sepulchre Cemetery.

researchRecord.name: 1912-1968, 3 cubic feet.
researchRecord.description: The papers of James P.B. Duffy contain diaries, memoranda books, address books, notebooks, legal documents, and miscellaneous papers. Also transcripts of impeachment proceedings of Halsted L. Ritter, U.S. District Judge for the Southern District of Florida, 1936. An unpublished register is available in the repository.
